name: Arpita Korwar
content: Arpita Korwar Arpita Korwar. I joined School of Mathematics and Computer Science, IIT Goa as an Assistant Professor in 2019. I finished my Ph.D from The Department of Computer Science and Engineering, IIT Kanpur under the guidance of Dr. Manindra Agrawal and Dr. Nitin Saxena in 2017. Research interests: Computational Complexity, Algebra. Arpita's picture Resume Email address: Teaching CS510: Fundamentals of Theoretical Computer Science: Semester I, 2019-20 Research papers Identity Testing for Constant-Width, and Commutative, Read Once Oblivious ABPs with Rohit Gurjar and Nitin Saxena at Computational Complexity Conference (CCC) 2016 [bib] Invited in the special issue of the journal Theory of Computation, Volume 13(2), 2017. Deterministic Identity Testing for Sum of Read Once ABPs with Rohit Gurjar, Nitin Saxena and Thomas Thierauf at Computational Complexity Conference (CCC) 2015 [bib] Journal of Computational Complexity, Aug 2016. Hitting-sets for ROABP and Sum of Set-Multilinear Circuits with Manindra Agrawal, Rohit Gurjar and Nitin Saxena at SIAM Journal of Computing (SICOMP) 2015 [bib]. Planarizing Gadgets for Perfect Matching do not Exist with Rohit Gurjar, Jochen Messner, Simon Straub and Thomas Thierauf at 37th International Symposium on Mathematical Foundations of Computer Science (MFCS), 2012 [bib]. Hitting-sets for low-distance multilinear depth-3 with Manindra Agrawal, Rohit Gurjar and Nitin Saxena Manuscript 2012 [bib]. Exact Perfect Matching in Complete Graphs with Rohit Gurjar, Jochen Messner and Thomas Thierauf ToCT 2015 [bib]. On Two-Level Poset Games with Stephen A. Fenner, Rohit Gurjar and Thomas Thierauf Manuscript 2011 [bib]. PhD Thesis Polynomial Identity Testing and Lower Bounds for Sum of Special ABPs. M.Tech Thesis Finding an NC algorithm for perfect matching in planar graphs. Hashing write-ups These topics were studied as part of the course "Special Advanced Topics in Computer Science" with Prof. Baswana. Write-up on Universal hashing and perfect hashing Bloom Filters Cuckoo Hashing Other write-ups Equivalence between two definitions of the determinant Favorite links Interesting Stuff
